title: NASA endorses “continuous heartbeat” approach to human presence in LEO
summary:
NASA has endorsed the need to have humans in orbit continuously as it navigates the transition from the ISS to commercial stations.
The post NASA endorses “continuous heartbeat” approach to human presence in LEO appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Thailand signs Artemis Accords
summary:
Thailand signed the Artemis Accords Dec. 16, becoming the first nation to join both that document and a similar Chinese-led agreement.
The post Thailand signs Artemis Accords appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: SpaceX launches U.S. Space Force ‘rapid response’ GPS mission
summary:
The mission named RRT-1 is the first “Rapid Response Trailblazer” launch designed to demonstrate U.S. capabilities to rapidly deploy national security satellites

title: Submarines for space exploration
summary: Submarines are emerging as a unique research platform to study human adaption to extreme environments – from ocean depths to outer space.

title: T-Mobile opens beta for Starlink smartphone connectivity
summary:
T-Mobile has opened beta registration for Starlink’s direct-to-smartphone satellite service, enabling text messaging early next year on select newer devices in most U.S. cellular dead zones with a clear sky view.
The post T-Mobile opens beta for Starlink smartphone connectivity appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA releases long-term strategy for robotic Mars exploration
summary:
NASA has refined its strategy for future robotic exploration of Mars, advocating for a regular cadence of smaller missions to answer key questions in advance of human missions.
The post NASA releases long-term strategy for robotic Mars exploration appeared first on SpaceNews.

summary: In this image from Dec. 11, 2024, the 212-foot-tall SLS (Space Launch System) core stage is lowered into High Bay 2 at the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. title: Starlink set to hit $11.8 billion revenue in 2025, boosted by military contracts
summary:
